item.summary: camel-core - DefaultSourceLoader fails to load sb route

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: It seems related to a yaml dsl file not being present - so it may be that if input stream is null, then it should return null
This may need to be backported to 4.10.x as well when we find the bug and fix it

This is caused by

The route definition exists @ BOOT-INF/classes/camel/timer-log-route.yaml
Ah CSB has a fat-jar resource loader to scan inside JARs

This seems to be a tricky combination of custom camel + sb resource loading, also not particularly caused by camel k8s. Without the added complexity of container runtime, you can reproduce it like this ...

 
cd camel-cloud-examples/tree/main/spring-boot/timer-log
make k8s-package

java -jar target/timer-log-1.0.0.jar
...
Caused by: java.io.IOException: No input stream for: nested:/Users/tdiesler/git/camel-cloud-examples/spring-boot/timer-log/target/timer-log-1.0.0.jar/!BOOT-INF/classes/!/camel/timer-log-route.yaml

	at org.apache.camel.impl.engine.DefaultRoutesLoader.findRoutesBuilders(DefaultRoutesLoader.java:162) ~[camel-base-engine-4.12.0-SNAPSHOT.jar!/:4.12.0-SNAPSHOT]

I tried replacing ...

/!BOOT-INF/classes/!/ => /!BOOT-INF/classes/camel/

but spring-boot did complain about not finding '!/'

This is recent regression. All SB examples fail for the same reason.
It turns out, that it may be sufficient to identify the resource as the path after the last instead of the first '!'
What was the problem was there some code change to fix something or was it something else ?
